jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Public Service/Circulation Assistant (Temporary Part-Time) Alliston , ON Description Date: April 24, 2024
Job Posting # 042024-01
The New Tecumseth Public Library is now seeking a people-oriented individual to work in all three Branches (Alliston, Tottenham and Beeton) as a Temporary Part-Time Public Service/Circulation Assistant (3 Month Contract). The successful applicants will be required to work with a very high degree of accuracy, exercise tact and independent judgment in accordance with library policy and must possess demonstrated respect and appreciation for patrons of all ages. It is anticipated that there will be opportunities for additional hours available from time to time, and that the applicant should be available to work at all three branches and have transportation to the same.
Requirements: Secondary School Graduation or higher At least 1 year of work experience Good communication skills (including reading, writing, listening and speaking skills) Proficiency in customer service skills Basic math and computer skills essential
Duties: Under supervision, perform basic Circulation Desk duties. Performs check in/check out of library materials. Handles money at the Circulation Desk including fines, photocopying and sale of materials. Handle telephone inquiries about library and circulation operations and respond to/follow up on requests for hold items. Promote library programs and initiatives (Library Guide, snap frame, bulletin boards, pamphlets, etc.). Shelve library materials and perform shelf reading Assist with preparation of received ILLO and Simcoe County Library materials. Other duties as may be assigned from time to time.
Wage Rate: $23.63 per hour plus 4% vacation pay.
Hours of Work: Up to an average of 20 hours per week. Hours and location are subject to change at any time.
Base Location: Pam Kirkpatrick Branch (Tottenham)
Please submit your cover letter and resume in Word or PDF format to jmole@ntpl.ca no later than 4:30PM on Wednesday 1 May 2024. Please quote Job Posting # 042024-01 in the subject line of your email.
We thank you for your interest, however; only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The New Tecumseth Public Library is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes. If contacted for an interview, please advise the recruiter if you require accommodation. Compensation $23.63 Closes: 1 May, 2024 New Tecumseth Public Library Alliston , ON Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

position: Librarian and Coordinator for Indigenous Initiatives
jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Librarian and Coordinator for Indigenous Initiatives Nanaimo , BC Description Duties:
Working under the general direction of the University Librarian, the Librarian and Coordinator for Indigenous Initiatives will provide leadership in a collaborative context to advocate for and advance decolonial approaches to strategy and practices in the Library.
The Librarian and Coordinator for Indigenous Initiatives: Develops and sustains reciprocal relationships with Indigenous Elders, faculty, and community members who contribute to guiding library practice and strategy for respecting Indigenous knowledges and value systems; seeking to ensure that they feel welcomed, supported, and respected in any form of engagement with VIU Library, in ways consistent with community or cultural protocols. Provides careful, strategic perspective and leadership in respect to protecting and promoting engagement with Indigenous knowledges in ways that align with guiding principles and practices received in relationship to local Coast Salish Elders and community members. Advances strategy related to decolonizing library services in local and collaborative contexts, including but not limited to decolonizing descriptive practice. Advocates for culturally responsive stewardship and care for Indigenous knowledges and content related to Indigenous peoples by providing perspective and contributing to collaborative initiatives with respect to Library collections and Special Collections, and other areas of Library work from time to time. Promotes Indigenous language revitalization and use, particularly Coast Salish languages, in library online and physical spaces. Incorporates decolonization principles and critically informed approaches into teaching and learning to foster a deeper understanding and engagement with Indigenous perspectives and knowledges. Participates in a wide range of activities in support of students, including instruction, reference, liaison duties, and collections.
Required Qualifications:
Master of Library and Information Science, or equivalent, from an ALA- accredited program. A minimum of 3 years experience working as an academic librarian, or a minimum of 3 years experience coordinating Indigenous initiatives in an academic or not-for-profit organization is preferred.
This position is open to all candidates; though Indigenous applicants will be preferred. If you wish to qualify for priority consideration, you are asked to self-identify in your cover letter.
If this job description is of interest to you, and you have a Master of Library/Information Science, or equivalent, from an ALA-accredited institution, we still encourage you to apply. We understand that experiences and qualifications vary.
Invitation to Apply:View the full position description and apply online here. Posting is open until May 1st, 2024. Vancouver Island University is a comprehensive teaching university with 13,000 students across four campuses. VIU proudly fosters student success, strong community connections and meaningful collaborations by providing access to a wide range of programs, from academic undergraduate and master’s to industry-responsive trades and vocational training.
VIU is pleased to offer employees a comprehensive benefit plan; ample paid holiday time; professional development opportunities and a desirable pension plan that takes the worry out of retirement. As part of the VIU campus community, you will work with supportive colleagues within an encouraging environment and are provided with the tools and training that promote learning and development. The perks of VIU employment are multiple, and include well-being initiatives and services, strategic discounts, and flexible work opportunities. The VIU community acknowledges and thanks the Snuneymuxw, Quw’utsun, Tla’amin, Snaw-naw-as and Qualicum First Nation on whose traditional lands we teach, learn, research, live and share knowledge. Compensation VIUFA F2: $71,141 - $114,001 per annum Closes: 1 May, 2024 Vancouver Island University Nanaimo , BC Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Chief Librarian Sparwood , BC Description CHIEF LIBRARIAN The Sparwood Public Library is a facility, which first established its operations in March12 1975. The library has a modern facility and is a beloved part of the community. Location: Sparwood, BC Reports to: Library Board General Accountability: The Chief Librarian organizes and directs all areas of library operations and provides vision and leadership to all aspects of the library in accordance with the Library Act of British Columbia and the established Policies and Procedures of the Sparwood t Public Library Board. The Chief Librarian makes recommendations and presents reports to the Board; manages staff; sets standards for collection development and programming; and promotes and represents the Library in the community, regionally, provincially, nationally and to other appropriate organizations. Specific Responsibilities: To the Board
• Act as secretary to the Board • Prepare meeting Agendas with Board Chair • Deliver agendas, minutes, financial and other reports, and communicates in a timely manner • Provide a written Library Director’s report for Board meetings and any other required reports to keep Board informed of current library activities • Notify the Board of any maintenance, security or repair problems. Recommend solutions. Review policies annually and present revisions to Board for approval • Interview and screen staff for library positions • Determine community needs for library services and recommend changes or improvements to the Board • Engage in strategic planning and community surveys with the direction of the Board • Assist Treasurer in preparing the annual budget for Board approval • Assist Treasurer in completion/submission of SOFI • Recommend, plan and implement fund raising activities as required
• Research and apply for grants to improve library services • Attend community meetings as required to promote or protect library services • Other related duties as agreed between the Board and the Library Director Supervisory Responsibilities • Direct staff and volunteers. • Interview and screen volunteers for vacant positions. • Ensure criminal records checks are completed and up to date for all staff and facilitators. Maintain staff/facilitator files. • Provide information on safety and library security. Correct unsafe practices as they arise. • Maintain procedure manual for staff to ensure high level of library service in the absence of the Library Director • Maintain procedure manual for volunteers
• Communicate changes to policies and procedures • Direct and evaluate job performance for staff as per policy. File reports. • Supervise scheduling of staff and volunteers • Ensure that staff read minutes from Board meetings to stay informed • Address problems with staff, volunteers, Board members and patrons immediately using sound problem solving techniques.
• sound problem solving techniques • Maintain an ‘incident book’ documenting incidents for review and action of Board if unable to resolve directly • Help recruit Board members, volunteers, and staff Administrative Responsibilities • Implement strategic plans and provide a quarterly report to Board. • Update, implement, and evaluate procedure manuals and approved policies • Manage online catalogue data and library website • Promote Sparwood library programs and services (articles, brochures, posters, website and Facebook) • Handle correspondence and filing
• Maintain communication/memberships with Libraries Branch (LB), Association of BC Public Library Directors (ABCPLD), British Columbia Library Association (BCLA), British Columbia Library Trustee Association (BCLTA), Kootenay Library Federation (KLF), SITKA • Keep informed of the BC Library Act, FOIPPA, Employment Standards Act and provincial initiatives related to libraries • Work with other agencies to promote the library and offer services. • Oversee granted projects; complete final reports • Administer approved staff hours in budget • Collect statistics (circulation, volunteer hours, public computer use, etc) • Complete/submit Annual Statistics and Grant reports to the Libraries Branch • Generate reports. Analyze statistics. Determine trends • Study BC library statistics to maintain/improve Sparwood Public Library
standards.
• Complete an inventory of library items every 2 years. • Update and maintain inventory of furniture and equipment. Store a copy off site for security purposes • Order office/library/janitorial supplies and equipment
• Arrange for repairs/maintenance of technical equipment, photocopier, plumbing, etc. to minimize disruption of library services; • Perform monthly computer back-ups and store off-site. Update computer logbook to maintain communication with technical support. Financial Responsibilities • Conduct all financial and budgetary activities of the library in accordance with Board Polices and Procedures and Purchasing Guidelines • Administer approved budget with the guidance of the Treasurer. Manage money transfers and credit card account. File receipts for monthly bookkeeping. Reconcile petty cash as needed. • Work with Treasurer to keep terms up to date • Report possible budget shortfalls to the Treasurer/Board in a timely manner • Record hours worked for all employees and casual staff (specifying project type if
different from regular wages) on a calendar for each pay period • Submit a payroll report to bookkeeper and issue paychecks • Pay bills and keep accurate records of all expenditures. • Keep accurate records of daily cash transactions: fines and fees, book sales, donations and sponsorships. Make deposits. Balance cash float. • Issue tax receipts for donations and book/magazine sponsorships • Track and record usage of donations that specify use • Keep accurate records of other revenue (grants, etc.) and manage spending • Post financials and deliver all paperwork to the bookkeeper for each month -end.
• Prepare year-end as required for bookkeeper. Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
• Excellent written, verbal and presentation communication skills.
• Thorough knowledge of automated library systems, communication technology including email and social media, and office software including Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint or other equivalent software
• Familiarity with basis principles and practice of networking computers, website design and management, information security and protection of privacy
• Basic knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting principles; able to read, interpret and create financial reports, balance sheets and financial documents. Required Qualifications:
• Master of Library and Information Science from an accredited Library school or equivalent combination of education and experience
• A minimum of 5 years related experience in a public library • Valid BC driver’s license To apply please submit your resume and cover letter no later than April 30, 2024. Interested candidates should send a resume and cover letter via email to: email address Director@sparwoodlibrary.ca Please state "Sparwood Public Library – Chief Librarian" in the subject line. We would like to thank everyone for their interest in this position but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Location: Sparwood, BC Compensation: Based on Experience and Ability to Perform
Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster
Please, no phone calls about this job!
Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.
